conclusion: To determine the temperature of the gas at state C, we need to use the ideal gas law and the information provided in the question.
Convert temperature at state A from Celsius to Kelvin: T_A = -73 + 273 = 200 K
The ideal gas law is given by PV = nRT
At state A: Pressure P_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, Volume V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3, Temperature T_A = 200 K
Substitute values into the ideal gas law at state A: 3 x 10^5 x 1 x 10^-3 = n x R x 200
Rearrange the equation to calculate number of moles n: n = 300 / (R x 200)
Using the value of R = 8.314 J/mol K
At state C: Pressure P_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa, Volume V_C = 4 x 10^-3 m^3
Substitute values into the ideal gas law at state C: 1 x 10^5 x 4 x 10^-3 = n x R x T_C
Solve for temperature at state C: T_C = 400 / (0.180 x 8.314)
The temperature of the gas at state C is approximately 267.4 K.
